title: open banking - payments initiation service

description:
the open banking payments initiation service provides functionality for initiating payments across various types of international and domestic accounts.

endpoints:
- post /payments/aspsps: retrieve a list of available aspsps for initiating cross-border or domestic payments.
- post /payments/consents/raw: extract the original raw consent details given by the aspsp.
- post /payments/cross-border-credit-transfers: initiates and processes a cross-border credit transfer transaction.
- post /payments/cross-border-credit-transfers/consents: initiates a consent for cross-border credit transfer via a redirect flow.
- post /payments/cross-border-credit-transfers/payment-status: retrieves the status of a cross-border credit transfer transaction.
- post /payments/domestic-credit-transfers: initiates and processes a domestic credit transfer transaction.
- post /payments/domestic-credit-transfers/consents: initiates a consent for domestic credit transfer via a redirect flow.
- post /payments/domestic-credit-transfers/payment-status: retrieves the status of a domestic credit transfer transaction.
- get /payments/health: retrieves the health status of the connectivity provider for the payment service.
- post /payments/sepa-credit-transfers: initiates and processes an sepa credit transfer transaction.
- post /payments/sepa-credit-transfers/consents: initiates a consent for sepa credit transfer via a redirect flow.
- post /payments/sepa-credit-transfers/payment-status: retrieves the status of an sepa credit transfer transaction.

thinking: this service handles the initiation of cross-border and domestic payments across banks, providing the necessary functionality to initiate transactions, retrieve payment statuses, and manage user consents.

endpoints:
- /registertoken: user authentication, password management, and security protocols (tokens) for user access.
- /btcmainnet/getblockcount: get current block number.
- /btcmainnet/getbestblockhash: get best block hash.
- /btcmainnet/getblock: get block details from a block hash.
- /btcmainnet/getblockchaininfo: get blockchain information.
- /btcmainnet/getblockhash: get block hash from a block number.
- /btcmainnet/getblockheader: get information about blockheader.
- /btcmainnet/getblockstats: get information about block statistic.
- /btcmainnet/getdifficulty: get information about pow difficulty.
- /btcmainnet/getmemoryinfo: get information about memory usage.
- /btcmainnet/uptime: get information about uptime.
- /btcmainnet/getconnectioncount: get information about connection count.
- /btcmainnet/getnettotals: get information about network summary.
- /btcmainnet/getpeerinfo: get information about each connected network node.
- /btcmainnet/ping: p2p ping.
- /btcmainnet/getutxobyaddress: address utxo.
- /btcmainnet/getbalancebyaddress: address balance.
- /btcmainnet/gettransactionbytxid: transaction by transaction hash.
- /btcmainnet/gettransactionbyaddress: transaction by address.
- /btcmainnet/createrawtransaction: create raw transaction.

title: extension 3: setting up saving goals

description:
this extension aims to assist users in saving up for specific goals such as a new car or a holiday. each month, the user will set aside a certain amount until they reach the target amount. the amount will remain in the account, but not be displayed in the balance. the user can create and delete saving goals, and specify the goal's name, amount, and monthly savings amount. additionally, the user can optionally set a minimal balance before money is set aside for each goal. the default for minimal balance is 0.

endpoints:
- get /savinggoals: retrieve all saving goals.
- post /savinggoals: create a new saving goal.
- delete /savinggoals/{savinggoalid}: delete a saving goal by id.

api summary: 
italicfinance client api provides endpoints for user management, invoice operations, and payment processing. 
api endpoints: 
- `/user`: get and initiate user information.
- `/user/refreshlink`: refresh the user access link.
- `/user/balance`: retrieve user account balance.
- `/user/createloginlink`: generate a login link for the user.
- `/user/verified`: update the user's verification status.
- `/invoice`: get a list of user invoices.
- `/invoice/{invoiceid}`: get details of a specific invoice by id.
- `/invoice/status`: update the status of a specific invoice.
- `/intent`: update the status of a payment intent.
</thinking>
<category> client </category>

title: simple bank api
description: this is a bank api
endpoints:
  - get /transactions: gets a list of transactions.
  - post /transactions: creates a new transaction for transferring money.
  - post /transactions/deposit: deposits money into an account.
  - post /transactions/withdraw: withdraws money from an account.
  - patch /accounts/{iban}: updates an account's details.
  - get /{username}/accounts: retrieves the accounts of a specific user.
  - post /{username}/accounts: creates a new account for a user.
  - get /users: returns a list of all users.
  - post /users: creates a new user account.
  - get /login: allows a user to log in using their credentials.
<thinking> the purpose of this api is to provide basic financial transactions, account management, and user authentication services for a simple bank. </thinking>

title: stocks-api
description: 
    this api is designed to provide information about stocks and their real-time prices. it allows you to fetch details about individual stocks by their unique id, update the price of a stock, view all available stocks, and create new stocks.
endpoints: 
    - get /stocks/{id} : retrieves detailed information about a specific stock by its unique id.
    - put /stocks/{id} : updates the price of a stock identified by its id.
    - get /stocks : retrieves a list of all available stocks.
    - post /stocks : allows you to create a new stock.

api summary:

title: mastercard blockchain

description: 
    the mastercard blockchain rest/json api provides a foundation for prototyping blockchain applications and to become familiar with the principles of blockchain technology, all using an advanced, high-performance, blockchain implementation from mastercard. the api allows you to specify your own transaction types and flows to meet any business need. a good guideline to using blockchain effectively is to first decide "what data is it that we need to share?". you will also want to check out our smart contract api as your functionality requirements get more complex. as your use case progresses, you will likely want to move from a fully hosted "blockchain as a service" to a hosted "distributed ledger technology" service. 

endpoints:
    - get /status
        gets general network status information
    - get /node
        gets information about network nodes
    - get /node/{address}
        gets information about a specific node on the network
    - get /app/{id}
        gets information about the specified application
    - post /app/{id}
        configure or update your application
    - get /address/{address}
        gets information about a specific address
    - get /block
        get information about a block or a range of blocks
    - get /block/{key}
        gets a specified block
    - put /entry
        adds a transaction entry to the blockchain
    - get /entry/{key}
        information about the specified transaction entry
    - post /support/encoding
        provides transforms between encodings
understood. now
